newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan's Central Bank offers 15 mln dinars in CDs.
newsitem.headline: Jordan's Central Bank offers 15 mln dinars in CDs.

text.p: The Central Bank of Jordan said on Sunday it was offering banks 15 million dinars in certificates of deposits in this week's auction.
Interest yields released on Sunday from last week's auction for three-month paper were unchanged at 9.250 percent.

Yields on six-month certificates were fixed at 9.500 percent, also unchanged from last week's rate. A Central Bank official said the issue was oversubsribed but did not give details. Outstanding CDs rose to 527.7 million dinars ($745.3 million) from 514 million dinars last week.
Repurchase agreements as collateral to weekly CDs remained at a high 10 percent with an unchanged 8.5 percent discount rate.
The Central Bank is maintaining a high interest rate policy to preserve the attractiveness of dinar-denominated assets to boost the local currency.
It also wants to curb any excessive outflow of dinars into dollar-denominated assets that could erode its foreign currency reserves.
